work.name: Freelance
highlights: Part-time instructor for undergrad/graduate courses
AI policy and governance in Africa
African language technologies
Deep learning engineering and AI for fun

work.name: International Finance Corporation (IFC), World Bank Group
highlights: AI and Startup Ecosystem Policy Research (West and Central Africa)
Evaluation of AI-powered local solutions developed in agtech, healthtech, createch, e-mobility, e-transport, and edtech
Organized and coordinated stakeholder consultations, workshops, and roundtable discussions engaging diverse stakeholders in collaboration; support with administrative tasks
Data Analysis on funding mechanisms, regulatory bareers, and innovation support programs

work.name: Techclick, UNDP & Ministry of ICT and Innovation (MINICT)
highlights: Supported the UNDP team with the qualitative assessment of the AI landscape
Conducted interviews with key informants from government institutions
Contributed to clarifying the roadmap for the implementation of the National AI Policy

work.name: Carnegie Mellon University Africa (CMU-Africa)
highlights: Assisted Prof. David Vernon with the development of a Semantically-modulated Joint Episodic-Procedural (S-JEP) Working Associative Memory
Proposed and implemented RT1-CRAM, a candidate S-JEP architecture
Managed and executed compute-intensive jobs on a supercomputer using Slurm for job scheduling and resource allocation
Managing the Wakanda AI project team under the Supervision of Prof Bhiksha Raj, Dr Moise Busogi, and Dr Abraham Nyete
Contributed to the drafting of the cross-university research proposal
Initiated work on R&D: Speech processing, Language modeling, Seamless communication in African languages
Team Assistant for administrative, monitoring, and coordination tasks

volunteer.organization: Advanced Cyberinfrastructure Coordination Ecosystem: Services & Support (ACCESS)
volunteer.position: Member of the Researcher Advisory Committee
volunteer.summary: Making suggestions to improve allocations, support, and operations
Volunteered at ICLR 2023, actively contributed to assisting attendees, and ensuring smooth operations

highlights: Motivated fellow students to join the Zindi network
Co-lead of the platform development group (improvements and new ideas)

volunteer.summary: Managed an increadible team of fellow graduate students passionate about AI and data science
